main event: In Detroit, Michigan on January 31, 1955, a bright blue-white object resembling a star transformed into a cigar-shaped object over a 3-minute observation.
interesting points: The edges of the object were sharply outlined, and it did not exhibit signs of explosion, breaking up, or emitting smoke or exhaust.
The object appeared to flicker at times during the observation.
The conclusion of the evaluation was that the observed object was Venus.
sighted object: bright blue-white star transforming into a cigar-shaped object
